title: Businesses tell Westminster to ‘get it sorted’ on Brexit as investment spending lags
text:
Deal or no deal, extension or general election? “Brexit uncertainty” is a phrase so well-worn since the referendum that it verges on cliche, but if you want to find out what it means in the real world for British business, just ask Paul Hetherington.

Mr Hetherington runs Marshall-Tufflex, a family-owned firm which makes plastic trunking for cables. The Hastings-based company, which has 160 staff and £20m in annual sales, spends heavily every year on the complex machines and tools needed to fashion complex cable housings – or at least it did, until recently.

Most of those tools come from places like China or Austria, so the business has already taken a currency hit from the pound’s fall since...
